tit.e: Naramachi Shiryokan (Street Museum in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)
tit.cmt: 余分な改行を削除し、補足しました。
tit.e: Naramachi Shiryokan (Street Museum in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 奈良町資料館（ならまちしりょうかん）は、奈良県奈良市の近世から近代にかけて建てられた町屋 (商家)が並ぶ地区、ならまちの一角にある私設資料館。
sen.e: The Naramachi Shiryokan (Street Museum) is a privately-run Shiryokan located in a corner of Naramachi where the streets are lined with Machiya (merchant house) built in Nara City, Nara Prefecture from the early-modern to modern times.

The Naramachi Shiryokan is a privately-run museum located in a corner of Naramachi area, where Machiya (merchant house) built from the early-modern to modern times were lined up in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行を削除し、表現を変えました。
sen.e: The Naramachi Shiryokan is a privately-run museum located in a corner of Naramachi area, where Machiya (merchant house) built from the early-modern to modern times were lined up in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 館長の自宅を改造し、奈良町の保存を目的として1985年に開館。
sen.e: It was opened in 1985 to promote the preservation of Naramachi by converting the director's own house into a museum.
It was opened in 1985 to promote the preservation of Naramachi by converting the director's own house into a museum.
It was opened in 1985 to promote the preservation of Naramachi by converting the director's own house into a museum.

sen.j: 館長が収集した、江戸時代から明治・大正にかけての看板や生活用品などの民俗資料や、仏像や骨董品などを展示している。
sen.e: It exhibits the director's collections including signboards from the Edo to Meiji/Taisho periods, folklore materials like living wares, Buddha statues and antiques.
It exhibits the director's collections including signboards from the Edo to Meiji and Taisho periods, folklore materials like living wares, Buddha statues and antiques.
It exhibits the director's collections including signboards from the Edo to Meiji and Taisho periods, folklore materials like living wares, Buddha statues and antiques.

sen.j: 住所：奈良県奈良市西新屋町14
sen.e: Address: 14 Nishinoshinya-cho, Nara-City, Nara Prefecture
Address: 14 Nishinoshinya-cho, Nara-City, Nara Prefecture
Address: 14 Nishinoshinya-cho, Nara-City, Nara Prefecture

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道関西本線（大和路線）奈良駅から徒歩約20分。
sen.e: About 20-minute walk from Nara Station of JR West Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line)
Approximately 20-minute walk from Nara Station of JR West Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line)
Approximately 20-minute walk from Nara Station of JR West Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line)

sen.j: 近鉄奈良線 近鉄奈良駅から徒歩約15分。
sen.e: About 15-minute walk from Kintetsu Nara Station of Kintetsu Nara Line
Approximately 15-minute walk from Kintetsu Nara Station of Kintetsu Nara Line
Approximately 15-minute walk from Kintetsu Nara Station of Kintetsu Nara Line
No entry fee.
No entry fee.
Hours: 10 am to 4 pm
Hours: 10 am to 4 pm

sen.j: 休館日 月曜日（月曜日が祝日の場合は開館し、翌日休館）
sen.e: Closed: Mondays ((except for National Holidays on Monday, in which case the museum is open on the holiday and closed the following Tuesday instead)
Closed: Mondays (except for National Holidays on Monday, in which case the museum is open on the holiday and closed the following Tuesday instead)
sen.cmt: 余分な括弧を削除しました。
sen.e: Closed: Mondays (except for National Holidays on Monday, in which case the museum is open on the holiday and closed the following Tuesday instead)

sen.j: ＜現在（2007年10月27日以降）、館主の死去に伴って土日祝のみの開館となっている＞
sen.e: <At the present time (After October 27, 2007), it is open only on Saturdays, Sundays and National Holidays following the director's death.>
(At the present time [After October 27, 2007], it is open only on Saturdays, Sundays and National Holidays following the director's death.)
(At the present time [After October 27, 2007], it is open only on Saturdays, Sundays and National Holidays following the director's death.)
